title: `add_sibling` in a pure Git repo is scary -- flavor of low-level should not log non-debug level messages

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
This appears in the screen:

````
[ERROR  ] Failed to run ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'annex', 'enableremote', '-c', 'remote.gh-mine.annex-ssh-options=-o ControlMaster=auto -S /home/mih/.config/datalad/github.com -o ControlMaster=auto -S /home/mih/.cache/datalad/sockets/5f9602bf', '-c', 'remote.gh-master.annex-ssh-options=-o ControlMaster=auto -S /home/mih/.config/datalad/github.com -o ControlMaster=auto -S /home/mih/.cache/datalad/sockets/5f9602bf', '-c', 'remote.gh-yarik.annex-ssh-options=-o ControlMaster=auto -S /home/mih/.cache/datalad/sockets/5f9602bf', '-c', 'remote.gh-ben.annex-ssh-options=-o ControlMaster=auto -S /home/mih/.config/datalad/github.com -o ControlMaster=auto -S /home/mih/.cache/datalad/sockets/5f9602bf', 'mike'] under '/home/mih/hacking/datalad/git'. Exit code=1. out= err=git-annex: First run: git-annex init
````

It is later identified as a non-issue and the command succeeds, but it sure doesn't look like that at first glance.

Edit: it is actually not happening in a pure Git repo. Maybe some traces of a previous annex config caused this behavior. However, the point still stands: no error logs from low-level operations!
